NAEB HEADQUARTERS
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington 6, D. C.
MEMORANDUM
TO: NAEB Board of Directors
FROM: Harold E. Hill
DATE: April 17, 1962
The NAEB Constitution committee has been considering, at the request of the
staff, four amendments to the Constitution and/or By-Laws.
You«11 recall that, at the time of the Board meeting here last October, the
Board felt that terms of Board members should be limited to two full terms
in succession. They also felt that, now that Headquarters is located in
Washington, the convention rotation provided for in the By-Laws should be
latered to provide for periodic conventions in Washington - perhaps every
four or five years. These two matters were referred to the Constitution
committee.
In addition, two other amendments were considered. One would permit the
Administrative Vice President to serve as official Treasurer of the Association,
and the other would expand our purposes to include mention of direct instruction.
The Constitution committee has approved of all four of these amendments and
they should now be voted on by the Board at the meeting in Columbus. Therefore,
I have attached the background information for your consideration - my original
memos to the committee and Chairman Walter Emery8 s memo to the committee
spelling out the specific amendments (which the cominittee has subseouently
approved)•
If the Board approves of these amendments, they will then be submitted to
the membership, by mail, for their vote as provided for in the Constitution
and By-Laws. The vehicle to be used to notify the membership will probably
be the Newsletter since we now attempt to use this as the official method for
transmittal of important items to the membership*
PLEASE BRING THIS MATERIAL TO THE BOARD MEETING WITH YOU.
HEH:abt
cc: Leonard Marks
